text.autoconfig.fastquit.title: FastQuit
text.autoconfig.fastquit.option.renderSa:
When playing on high render distance, quitting the world can still take a bit because the client-side chunk storage has to be cleared.
By enabling this setting the "Saving world" screen will be rendered.
text.autoconfig.fastquit.option.showToas: Determines whether a toast gets shown when a world finishes saving.
text.autoconfig.fastquit.option.showSavi: Determines whether the time it took/takes to save the world gets displayed on toasts and the world list.
text.autoconfig.fastquit.option.backgrou:
Sets the thread priority of the server when saving worlds in the background.
This is done to improve client performance while saving, but will make the saving take longer over all.
text.autoconfig.fastquit.option.allowMul:
When this option is enabled, you can join a new world while the old one is still saving.
This is safe to do in vanilla Minecraft, but some mods may have issues when 2 servers run at the same time.
fastquit.modmenu.summaryTranslation.fast: Return to the Title Screen while the world is still saving!
This mod lets you return to the Title Screen early while your world is still saving in the background.
